domains.description: Quantum phenomena, particle physics, relativity, thermodynamics, and field theory

superposition.name: Superposition
superposition.definition: Quantum state existing in multiple states simultaneously

entanglement.name: Entanglement
entanglement.definition: Quantum correlation between particles regardless of distance

wave_particle_duality.name: Wave-Particle Duality
wave_particle_duality.definition: Matter exhibiting both wave and particle properties

uncertainty_principle.name: Uncertainty Principle
uncertainty_principle.definition: Fundamental limit to precision of simultaneous measurements

decoherence.name: Decoherence
decoherence.definition: Loss of quantum coherence through environmental interaction

wavefunction_collapse.name: Wavefunction Collapse
wavefunction_collapse.definition: Reduction to definite state upon measurement

quark.name: Quark
quark.definition: Elementary particle and fundamental constituent of matter

lepton.name: Lepton
lepton.definition: Elementary particle not subject to strong force

boson.name: Boson
boson.definition: Particle with integer spin obeying Bose-Einstein statistics

fermion.name: Fermion
fermion.definition: Particle with half-integer spin obeying Pauli exclusion

spacetime.name: Spacetime
spacetime.definition: Four-dimensional continuum of space and time

time_dilation.name: Time Dilation
time_dilation.definition: Difference in elapsed time due to relative velocity or gravity

length_contraction.name: Length Contraction
length_contraction.definition: Decrease in length of moving object

event_horizon.name: Event Horizon
event_horizon.definition: Boundary beyond which events cannot affect observer

black_hole.name: Black Hole
black_hole.definition: Region of spacetime with extreme gravitational pull

general_relativity.name: General Relativity
general_relativity.definition: Theory of gravitation as spacetime curvature

special_relativity.name: Special Relativity
special_relativity.definition: Theory of space and time for inertial frames

entropy.name: Entropy
entropy.definition: Measure of disorder or randomness in system

heat_capacity.name: Heat Capacity
heat_capacity.definition: Amount of heat needed to change temperature

partition_function.name: Partition Function
partition_function.definition: Sum over all possible states in statistical mechanics

electromagnetic_field.name: Electromagnetic Field
electromagnetic_field.definition: Physical field produced by electrically charged objects

renormalization.name: Renormalization
renormalization.definition: Technique to remove infinities in quantum field theory

domains.description: Organic chemistry, inorganic chemistry, physical chemistry, materials, and analytical techniques

functional_group.name: Functional Group
functional_group.definition: Specific group of atoms within molecule

isomer.name: Isomer
isomer.definition: Molecules with same formula but different structure

polymer.name: Polymer
polymer.definition: Large molecule composed of repeating units

hydrocarbon.name: Hydrocarbon
hydrocarbon.definition: Compound consisting of hydrogen and carbon

crystal_structure.name: Crystal Structure
crystal_structure.definition: Ordered arrangement of atoms in crystal

semiconductor.name: Semiconductor
semiconductor.definition: Material with conductivity between conductor and insulator

transition_metal.name: Transition Metal
transition_metal.definition: Element with partially filled d orbitals

ligand.name: Ligand
ligand.definition: Ion or molecule bonded to central metal atom

metallic_bond.name: Metallic Bond
metallic_bond.definition: Bonding in metals through delocalized electrons

chemical_equilibrium.name: Chemical Equilibrium
chemical_equilibrium.definition: State where forward and reverse rates equal

electrochemistry.name: Electrochemistry
electrochemistry.definition: Study of chemical processes involving electricity

spectroscopy.name: Spectroscopy
spectroscopy.definition: Study of interaction between matter and radiation

molecular_orbital.name: Molecular Orbital
molecular_orbital.definition: Region where electrons reside in molecule

composite_material.name: Composite Material
composite_material.definition: Material made from two or more constituents

alloy.name: Alloy
alloy.definition: Mixture of metals or metal with other elements

graphene.name: Graphene
graphene.definition: Single layer of carbon atoms in hexagonal lattice

smart_material.name: Smart Material
smart_material.definition: Material that responds to environmental changes

metamaterial.name: Metamaterial
metamaterial.definition: Engineered material with properties not found in nature

nmr_spectroscopy.name: NMR Spectroscopy
nmr_spectroscopy.definition: Technique exploiting magnetic properties of nuclei

uv_vis_spectroscopy.name: UV-Vis Spectroscopy
uv_vis_spectroscopy.definition: Technique using ultraviolet and visible light

domains.description: Brain structures, neurotransmitters, neural processes, cognitive functions, and disorders

cerebral_cortex.name: Cerebral Cortex
cerebral_cortex.definition: Outer layer of brain responsible for higher functions

hippocampus.name: Hippocampus
hippocampus.definition: Brain region critical for memory formation

amygdala.name: Amygdala
amygdala.definition: Brain structure involved in emotion processing

cerebellum.name: Cerebellum
cerebellum.definition: Brain region coordinating movement and balance

temporal_lobe.name: Temporal Lobe
temporal_lobe.definition: Brain region for auditory processing and memory

dopamine.name: Dopamine
dopamine.definition: Neurotransmitter involved in reward and motivation

acetylcholine.name: Acetylcholine
acetylcholine.definition: Neurotransmitter for muscle activation and memory

endorphin.name: Endorphin
endorphin.definition: Neurotransmitter producing pain relief and pleasure

synaptic_plasticity.name: Synaptic Plasticity
synaptic_plasticity.definition: Ability of synapses to strengthen or weaken

neurotransmission.name: Neurotransmission
neurotransmission.definition: Process of signal transmission between neurons

myelination.name: Myelination
myelination.definition: Formation of myelin sheath around axons

axon.name: Axon
axon.definition: Long projection of neuron conducting impulses

cognitive_control.name: Cognitive Control
cognitive_control.definition: Ability to regulate thoughts and actions

perception.name: Perception
perception.definition: Organization and interpretation of sensory information

consciousness.name: Consciousness
consciousness.definition: State of being aware of surroundings

stroke.name: Stroke
stroke.definition: Interruption of blood supply to brain

domains.description: DNA/RNA, gene regulation, genetic engineering, evolution, and molecular techniques

rna.name: RNA
rna.definition: Ribonucleic acid involved in protein synthesis

codon.name: Codon
codon.definition: Three-nucleotide sequence coding for amino acid

transcription.name: Transcription
transcription.definition: Process of copying DNA to RNA

translation.name: Translation
translation.definition: Process of synthesizing protein from RNA

messenger_rna.name: Messenger RNA
messenger_rna.definition: RNA carrying genetic information for protein synthesis

gene_expression.name: Gene Expression
gene_expression.definition: Process of gene information being used

epigenetics.name: Epigenetics
epigenetics.definition: Heritable changes not involving DNA sequence

methylation.name: Methylation
methylation.definition: Addition of methyl groups to DNA

vector.name: Vector
vector.definition: DNA molecule for transferring genetic material

pcr.name: PCR
pcr.definition: Polymerase chain reaction for DNA amplification

cell_culture.name: Cell Culture
cell_culture.definition: Growth of cells under controlled conditions

metadata.phase_description: Advanced scientific domains including physics, chemistry, neuroscience, and genetics
